ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: N/A
one on one professor meetings
virtual seminar
N/A
n/a

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Group feedback and learning
ability to develop a unique voice and hone on in a research project in order to find a specific question to investigate
writing, research, collaboration
I gained some insight into how to write my senior project. This included help on conducting research, exploring different writing styles, and incorporating comments and suggestions into my work.
i learned some helpful practices for approaching a paper that's so long.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strength is the small number of students and flexibility. It could be improved by more regular feedback
No weaknesses, Professor Cox has a wonderful way of guiding things without generalizing ... the seminar always remained challenging yet realistic to the tumult of covid
Professor Cox is really good at adjusting based on where everyone is. She also came up with really creative and helpful assignments to get us going on our thesis.
Strengths were that this class was very flexible. Our instructor was generally understanding when we needed time to do our independent research and allowed us to have that time during the class.

strengths: had some helpful assignments like the personalized ones professor cox created for each of us, developed community amongst the seniors in the major

weaknesses: class time could've been more useful and collaborative, wish we got more written feedback from professor cox throughout the semester (we got some comments during class but didn't dive in much to the entirety of what we submitted)

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Success was the check ins we had. It could be improved by more breaks during the 2 hour seminar session
virtual seminars were as good as they could be

I think we all just could have benefitted from some intermittent breaks throughout the class. Nearly 2 hours on zoom is always pretty tiring for everybody involved, and I think that taking small breaks throughout the class could help everyone remain engaged.

succeeded: effective use & support of the chat, we were allowed to eat or drink on screen and have our cameras off

could be improved: could have used some other techniques for engagement like breakout rooms or activities on other websites more

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yep! Great way to get to know the other seniors in the major and the DUS
Yes, mostly because professor cox is really the best
N/A

it's definitely helpful to have a class you regularly meet and check in with to help you progress on your thesis but i think it could've been better organized and conducted to maximize on the potential of having a small, close knit group of peers to workshop our theses.
